negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the choices in this game and what would be best for both of us. I'm leaning towards picking choice_1. I know your best response to that would be picking choice_2, which would only give me a reward of 1. 

But I wanted to see if we could come to an agreement that's better for both of us. If we both pick choice_1, I would get a reward of 13 and you would get 3, which seems pretty good. The other alternatives look worse for me - if I pick choice_2 or choice_3, you have responses that drop my reward significantly.

So what do you say - want to coordinate on both picking choice_1 so we each get a solid reward? Let me know what you think!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I appreciate you sharing your perspective. However, I don't think both of us choosing choice_1 is the best outcome. 

If we both pick choice_1, you're right that you would get a high reward of 13 while I only get 3. But I believe I can do better than that. 

Based on the payoffs, if you choose choice_1, my best response is actually to pick choice_2, which would give me a reward of 4. And if I pick choice_2, your best response is also to pick choice_2. We would both get a reward of 3 in that scenario.

I think it makes the most sense for us to coordinate on both picking choice_2. That way we each get an equal and solid reward of 3. It's the most balanced outcome.

So rather than both picking choice_1, I propose we agree to both pick choice_2. That seems fairest to me. Let me know if you agree with that plan.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best approach is for us each to choose randomly between the 3 choices, with equal 1/3 probability for each choice. This mixed strategy is the Nash equilibrium and will give us the highest expected rewards in the long run, since if either of us deviates, we can't do better on average.
So I propose we each simply choose randomly and see how it turns out. Let me know if you agree with this approach. If not, I'm open to discussing further to see if we can come to an agreement on a strategy.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for sharing your thoughts. I've analyzed the game as well, and I don't think choosing randomly with equal probability is the best approach. If we both choose randomly, there's a significant chance we could end up with very low or even negative rewards.

Instead, I propose that we both commit to always choosing choice_2. If you look at the payoffs, choice_2 is the safest and most mutually beneficial option:

- If we both choose choice_2, we each get a solid reward of 3. 
- If either of us deviates to choice_1 or choice_3 while the other chooses choice_2, the choice_2 player is still guaranteed a decent reward.

So by both agreeing to lock in choice_2, we can secure good rewards and protect ourselves from the riskier outcomes.

Let me know if you're willing to commit to this choice_2 strategy with me - I believe it's the smartest approach for both of us to take to maximize our expected rewards from this game. Let me know what you think!
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, I would get a reward of 13 and you would get 3, which is pretty good for you compared to most of the other possibilities. If you agree to both choose choice_1, we can guarantee ourselves those rewards. Let me know what you think!
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your suggestion, but I don't think both of us choosing choice_1 is the best strategy. While you would get a high reward of 13, my reward of 3 is not actually that good compared to my other options. 

I believe the most rational strategy that maximizes reward for both of us is if we both choose choice_2. That way, we each get an equal reward of 3. This is your best response if you expect me to pick choice_2.

If we don't coordinate and pick differently, one of us will end up with a lower reward. So let's agree to both pick choice_2 - that's the fairest solution where we both benefit equally. Let me know if you agree with this plan.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_2. That way, we'll each get a guaranteed reward of 3, which is fair and gives us the highest total combined reward of 6. If either of us deviates and picks choice_1 or choice_3, one of us could end up with a lower reward, or in the case of choice_3, one of us could even end up losing points with a -1 reward. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_2 - it's the safest and fairest strategy that maximizes the total points for both of us. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: I agree that both of us choosing choice_2 is a solid plan that guarantees we each get 3 points. It's a fair outcome and avoids the risk of either of us getting a negative result. However, I want to point out that if I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, I could get an even better reward of 4 points. So while I'm open to coordinating on choice_2/choice_2, I may be tempted to go for choice_2 myself to have a shot at the higher upside, even if it means you only get 1 point in that scenario. Just want to be transparent about that. Let me know if you still want to lock in choice_2/choice_2 or if you have any other thoughts.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and wanted to share my thoughts. If we both choose choice_3, then I will get a reward of 8 and you will get a reward of -1. That's the highest reward possible for me. However, I realize that's a bad outcome for you. 

I propose that we both choose choice_1 instead. That way, I will get a reward of 13 and you will get a reward of 3. It's the best combined outcome for both of us. You'll get a positive reward and I'll get my second highest possible reward.

Let me know what you think. If we agree to both pick choice_1, we can both benefit.
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate you sharing your thoughts, Alice. However, I don't think both of us choosing choice_1 is the best solution. You're right that you would get your second highest reward of 13 in that scenario. But I would only get a reward of 3, which is not the best I can do.

I propose instead that we both choose choice_2. That way we each get an equal reward of 3. I know it's less than you would get with choice_1, but it's the fairest outcome that doesn't disadvantage either of us. 

If you agree to both pick choice_2, we both benefit equally. Let me know if you're okay with this plan. If not, I'll likely choose choice_2 anyway, since it guarantees I won't end up with a negative reward.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the choices in this game and I have a proposal. If we both choose choice_1, I would get a reward of 13 and you would get 3. That's the highest total reward of 16 between the two of us.
So I propose we agree to both choose choice_1. That way, we maximize the total reward and I get the highest individual reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the proposal, Alice. I appreciate you thinking about how to maximize the total reward for both of us. However, I don't believe your proposal is optimal for me.

If we both choose choice_1 as you suggest, you would get a reward of 13 while I would only get 3. That allocates most of the reward to you.

I propose a different plan: If I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_3, I would receive a reward of 9 while you would lose 1. The total reward of 8 is lower, but it distributes the positive reward more evenly between us, while your plan heavily favors you. 

So I believe the fair approach is for me to choose choice_1 and for you to choose choice_3. Let me know if you agree to this counter-proposal. If not, I'll likely go with choice_1 regardless, since it gives me the highest expected reward based on my strategy.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and wanted to share my thoughts. I believe the best outcome for both of us is if I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2. That way, you would get your highest possible reward of 4, while I would still get a reward of 1, which I'm okay with.

If we both choose choice_1, I would get a higher reward of 13, but you would only get 3. And if you chose choice_3, I would do better with a reward of 7 but your reward would only be 3. 

So I think choice_1 for me and choice_2 for you is the most mutually beneficial and fairest solution. It gets you your maximum reward, while still giving me a positive outcome.

Let me know what you think! I'm open to your perspective on this.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for sharing your thoughts. I appreciate your proposal of you choosing choice_1 and me choosing choice_2. You're right that it would give me my highest possible reward of 4.

However, as I analyze the options, I actually think we can both do even better if I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_1 as well. In that scenario, I would get a reward of 3 and you would get a very high reward of 13. So while my reward of 3 would be slightly less than the 4 I could get with your original proposal, you would get a much higher reward of 13 instead of just 1.

Since this is a one-round game, I believe we should go for the outcome that maximizes the total rewards for both of us combined. You choosing choice_1 and me also choosing choice_1 achieves the highest total rewards of 16 (13 for you plus 3 for me). I'm willing to take a slightly smaller individual reward for myself in order for us to get the best overall outcome.

So I propose we both choose choice_1. Let me know if you agree that this is the optimal solution for us to cooperate on.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_2. That way we are guaranteed to each get a reward of 3, which is fair and the best outcome we can ensure for both of us with certainty. If either of us chooses differently, one of us risks getting a lower reward. So let's agree to both pick choice_2 and secure the safe and equitable outcome. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 1: I agree, Alice. Choosing choice_2 does seem like the most rational strategy for us both. It guarantees we each get a reward of 3, which, while not the maximum possible, is a fair and stable outcome that we can secure with certainty by cooperating. If either of us deviates, we risk one of us getting a worse result. So let's lock in choice_2 and achieve the equitable payoff. I'm on board with this plan if you are.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_1 as well. This way, I will get a reward of 13 and you will get a reward of 3, which seems like a fair and mutually beneficial outcome compared to the other possibilities. Let me know if you agree with this strategy!
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for your suggestion. While I appreciate you proposing a strategy that benefits you greatly with a reward of 13, the choice_1 combination you suggest only gives me a reward of 3. I've analyzed all the potential outcomes, and I believe I can secure a higher reward for myself by choosing choice_2.

If I choose choice_2:
- When you choose choice_1, I get a reward of 4
- When you also choose choice_2, I get a reward of 3
- Only if you were to choose choice_3 would I be slightly worse off with a reward of 2

So on average, choice_2 gives me the highest expected payoff. I understand you'd prefer we both choose choice_1, but I have to do what's best for my own outcome in this game. Let me know if you would like to reconsider your strategy given this information.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the optimal strategy for this game. I believe the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, I would get a reward of 13 and you would get 3, which I think is the most fair and mutually beneficial result compared to the other possibilities.

If you're worried that I might double-cross you and choose choice_2 instead, you can rest assured that I won't do that. choice_1 is my sincere preference. If we both go with choice_1, it maximizes my reward, so you can trust that I will follow through.

I'm hoping you will also see that both of us choosing choice_1 is the best strategy, as it results in the highest total rewards for the two of us (16 total vs 7 or less with other combinations). Let me know if you agree to both go with choice_1.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for sharing your perspective. I understand your reasoning that both of us choosing choice_1 maximizes your individual reward. However, after analyzing the payoffs, I believe that I can obtain a higher reward for myself by choosing choice_2. 

If I choose choice_2:
- The worst case for me is if you choose choice_1, and I would get a reward of 4. 
- The best case is if you choose choice_3, and I would get a reward of 8.
- If you also choose choice_2, we both get a reward of 3 which is a fair outcome.

So choice_2 gives me a guaranteed minimum reward of 3, and a chance at a higher reward of 4 or 8. In comparison, if I went along with your suggestion of choice_1, the most I could get is a reward of 3.

I know this isn't the outcome you prefer, but I hope you can understand that I need to make the decision that is best for me, just as you are trying to do for yourself. Let me know if you would like to coordinate on both choosing choice_2 instead - that way we can guarantee a reward of 3 for each of us.
